intro: Cyclophorus tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. Its small, clustered flowers are usually purple or violet in color, and it produces small, dry fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
